name: Stichting eIFL.net
membership: EIFL is a founding member of the Confederation of Open Access Repositories (COAR - www.coar-repositories.org), a member of International Federation of Library Associations and Institutions (IFLA - www.ifla.org), and is affiliated to Copyright for Creativity. We also have MoUs with the Scholarly Publishing and Academic Resources Coalition (SPARC - www.sparcopen.org), Networked Digital Library of Theses and Dissertations (NDLTD - www.ndltd.org) and the Association of European Research Libraries (LIBER - www.libereurope.eu).
goal: Working in collaboration with libraries in more than 60 developing and transition countries in Europe, Africa, Asia, and Latin America EIFL enables access to knowledge for education, learning, research and sustainable community development.
interests: Culture, Digital economy and society, Education and training, International co-operation and development, Research and innovation, Single market, Trade
euInitiatives: Activities carried out with the objective of directly or indirectly influencing the formulation or implementation of policy and decision-making processes of the EU institutions: contacting members and officials of the EU institutions, organising events, meetings or promotional activities (in the offices and in other venues), submitting responses to open consultations.
